19#include "BitMatrix.h"
20#include "ByteArray.h"
21
22#include <array>
23#include <cstddef>
24
25namespace ZXing {
26namespace DataMatrix {
27
28struct BitPos
29{
30 int row, col;
31};
32
33using BitPosArray = std::array<BitPos, 8>;
34
35/**
36 * VisitMatrix gets a functor/callback that is responsible for processing/visiting the bits in the matrix.
37 * The return value contains a BitMatrix where each bit that has been visited is set.
38 */
39template <typename VisitFunc>
40BitMatrix VisitMatrix(int numRows, int numCols, VisitFunc visit)
41{
42 // <p>See ISO 16022:2006, Figure F.3 to F.6</p>
43 const BitPosArray CORNER1 = {{{-1, 0}, {-1, 1}, {-1, 2}, {0, -2}, {0, -1}, {1, -1}, {2, -1}, {3, -1}}};
44 const BitPosArray CORNER2 = {{{-3, 0}, {-2, 0}, {-1, 0}, {0, -4}, {0, -3}, {0, -2}, {0, -1}, {1, -1}}};
45 const BitPosArray CORNER3 = {{{-1, 0}, {-1,-1}, {0, -3}, {0, -2}, {0, -1}, {1, -3}, {1, -2}, {1, -1}}};
46 const BitPosArray CORNER4 = {{{-3, 0}, {-2, 0}, {-1, 0}, {0, -2}, {0, -1}, {1, -1}, {2, -1}, {3, -1}}};
47
48 BitMatrix visited(numCols, numRows);
49 auto logAccess = [&visited](BitPos p){ visited.set(p.col, p.row); };
50
51 int row = 4;
52 int col = 0;
53
54 auto corner = [&numRows, &numCols, logAccess](const BitPosArray& corner) {
55 auto clamp = [](int i, int max) { return i < 0 ? i + max : i; };
56 BitPosArray result;
57 for (size_t bit = 0; bit < 8; ++bit) {
58 result[bit] = {clamp(corner[bit].row, numRows), clamp(corner[bit].col, numCols)};
59 logAccess(result[bit]);
60 }
61 return result;
62 };
63
64 auto utah = [&numRows, &numCols, logAccess](int row, int col) {
65 const BitPosArray delta = {{{-2, -2}, {-2, -1}, {-1, -2}, {-1, -1}, {-1, 0}, {0, -2}, {0, -1}, {0, 0}}};
66
67 BitPosArray result;
68 for (size_t bit = 0; bit < 8; ++bit) {
69 int r = row + delta[bit].row;
70 int c = col + delta[bit].col;
71 if (r < 0) {
72 r += numRows;
73 c += 4 - ((numRows + 4) % 8);
74 }
75 if (c < 0) {
76 c += numCols;
77 r += 4 - ((numCols + 4) % 8);
78 }
79 result[bit] = {r, c};
80 logAccess(result[bit]);
81 }
82 return result;
83 };
84
85 do {
86 // Check the four corner cases
87 if ((row == numRows) && (col == 0))
88 visit(corner(CORNER1));
89 else if ((row == numRows - 2) && (col == 0) && (numCols % 4 != 0))
90 visit(corner(CORNER2));
91 else if ((row == numRows + 4) && (col == 2) && (numCols % 8 == 0))
92 visit(corner(CORNER3));
93 else if ((row == numRows - 2) && (col == 0) && (numCols % 8 == 4))
94 visit(corner(CORNER4));
95
96 // Sweep upward diagonally to the right
97 do {
98 if ((row < numRows) && (col >= 0) && !visited.get(col, row))
99 visit(utah(row, col));
100
101 row -= 2;
102 col += 2;
103 } while (row >= 0 && col < numCols);
104
105 row += 1;
106 col += 3;
107
108 // Sweep downward diagonally to the left
109 do {
110 if ((row >= 0) && (col < numCols) && !visited.get(col, row))
111 visit(utah(row, col));
112
113 row += 2;
114 col -= 2;
115 } while ((row < numRows) && (col >= 0));
116
117 row += 3;
118 col += 1;
119 } while ((row < numRows) || (col < numCols));
120
121 return visited;
122}
123
124/**
125* Symbol Character Placement Program. Adapted from Annex M.1 in ISO/IEC 16022:2000(E).
126*/
127class DefaultPlacement
128{
129public:
130 static BitMatrix Place(const ByteArray& codewords, int numcols, int numrows);
131};
132
133} // DataMatrix
134} // ZXing
